summary:
8. Reiterates its call to prevent and suppress terrorist acts by ISIL, Al-Nusra Front, and other associated groups, and notes that the ceasefire will not apply to actions against these groups.

9. Welcomes the effort to develop a common understanding of individuals and groups for possible determination as terrorists within the ISSG.

10. Emphasizes the need for confidence-building measures to contribute to a political process and lasting ceasefire.

11. Requests the Secretary-General to report on options for further confidence-building measures within one month.

12. Calls on parties to allow humanitarian agencies rapid, safe, and unhindered access throughout Syria, and demands the full implementation of relevant resolutions.

13. Demands that all parties cease attacks against civilians and civilian objects, and comply with international law, including international humanitarian law.

14. Underscores the need to build conditions for the safe and voluntary return of refugees and internally displaced persons, and urges Member States to provide assistance.

15. Requests the Secretary-General to report on the implementation of this resolution within 60 days.

16. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
